Deleting the ROB Details Follow the steps below to delete the details of ROB: Hover over the required ROB.  The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button Note - The same process to add, edit, and delete ROB details is followed for the Resumed Point as well. Summary This page provides basic downtime details such as downtime hours and distance covered. It also includes two sections: Analysis , which shows the reason for downtime with calculated hours, and Consumptions , which displays fuel oil details—like type, bunker received, bunker adjusted, downtime consumption, and the difference—in a tabular format. Downtime hours and distance covered are auto-calculated, while consumption details are view-only on this page. Analysis Modifying the Analysis Details Click the Edit button under Analysis section. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - Consumptions The Consumptions details re view-only on this page. Modifying the Superintendent Remarks Follow the steps given below to modify the remarks Click the Edit button under Remarks sections. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Documents Adding the Document Follow the steps below to add a new Document details: Click on the "Upload" button. This will open up the Add Document screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Modifying the Document Details Follow the steps below to modify the required Document Details: Hover over the required Document. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon . The menu appears with two options - Edit and Delete . Click "Edit" option. This will open the Edit Documents screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Viewing the Document Details Follow the steps below to view the Document: Click on the required attached document where the hyperlink is given for which you want to view the details. This will open the View Documents page in read-only mode. Click the "Close" button to exit. Deleting the Document Follow the steps below to delete the Document: Hover over the required Document. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon . The menu appears with two options - Edit and Delete . Click "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Audit Log This page shows the audit log of the Downtime with their user details, log details and description.

Click "Edit" option. This will open the Edit Documents screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Viewing the Document Details Follow the steps below to view the Document: Click on the required attached document where the hyperlink is given for which you want to view the details. This will open the View Documents page in read-only mode. Click the "Close" button to exit. Deleting the Document Follow the steps below to delete the Document: Hover over the required Document. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon . The menu appears with two options - Edit and Delete . Click "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Audit Log This page shows the audit log of the Downtime with their user details, log details and description. You can navigate through Operations > Deviation and Downtime > View Details > Audit Log The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. . Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the Downtime Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of Downtime Hover over the required Downtime. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Change the required status. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Deleting the Downtime Follow the steps below to delete the Downtime: Hover over the required Downtime. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Current Status and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon . The menu appears with two options - Edit and Delete . Click "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Logics Applied Downtime - View details - Location - ROB Resumed point Fuel Oil type Received ROB Consumption Consumption = (ROB of point Starting point + Received at Resumed point) - ROB of resumed point Summary of Downtime Downtime hours Downtime Hours = Time taken between Starting and Resumed point Distance covered Distance Covered = 0 for downtime Downtime Consumption Downtime Consumption = Consumption at Resumed Point Difference Difference = Downtime Consumption
Environmental Reports track a vessel’s halocarbon use and discharges to help ensure it follows environmental regulations.

metadata.title: Operations Module > Environmental Reports > Vessel Halocarbons
Operations Module > Environmental Reports > Vessel Halocarbons

__data__.text: Halocarbons Inventory is a record of the types and amounts of halocarbon gases used, stored, released, or recovered—mainly for environmental tracking and compliance. You can access the Vessel Halocarbons page from here: Explorer Menu > Operations > Environmental Reports > Vessel Halocarbons Finding the Vessel Halocarbon of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to search the required Vessel Halocarbon: Select the required Vessels / Types / Fleets / Classes / Groups, Halocarbons and Halocarbon System in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system displays a list of vessels, including details of their associated halocarbon usage and records . This page provides complete details of the halocarbon inventory, including vessel name, halocarbon type, system, quantity in service, quantity in stock, ROB (Remaining Onboard), updated on, and updated by. You can also Add/Register, Delete, and Access the inventory details of each vessel halocarbon. The following information is mandatory for registering a new Vessel Halocarbon: Vessel Name Halocarbon System Halocarbon Date Quantity In Stock Quantity In Service Remarks Registering the Vessel Halocarbon Follow the steps below to register a new Vessel Halocarbon: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Register Vessel Halocarbon screen. Fill in the required details. Make sure to fill all the mandatory fields. Click the "Save" button. Viewing the Vessel Halocarbon Details Follow the steps below to view the required Vessel Halocarbon details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. The system will display the transactions page by default. Adding the Transaction Follow the steps below to add a new Transaction: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add Transaction screen. Fill in the required details. Make sure to fill all the mandatory fields. Click the "Save" button. Modifying the Transaction Follow the steps below to modify the required transaction: Hover over the required Date. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Edit" option. This will open up Edit Transaction screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. (Note - Only the most recent entry can be edited or deleted.  Only for the first transaction, the ROB will be the same as the previous ROB. From the second transaction onward, the previous ROB will be carried forward from the ROB of the first transaction. When all transactions associated with a specific halocarbon are deleted, the system will automatically delete the halocarbon record as well.) Deleting the Transaction Follow the steps below to delete the required Transaction: Hover over the required Date. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Audit Log This page shows the audit log of the Transactions with their user details, log details and description. You can navigate through: Operations > Environmental Reports > Vessel Halocarbons > View Details > Audit Log The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. Click the "Close" button to exit. Deleting the Vessel Halocarbon Follow the steps below to delete the required vessel halocarbon: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button.

You can access the Discharges page from here: Explorer Menu > Operations > Environmental Reports > Discharges Finding the Discharge of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to search the required Discharge: Select the required Vessels / Types / Fleets / Classes / Groups, From Date, To Date, Discharge Item, Discharge Method, Discharge Category and Status in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system displays a list of vessels, including details of their associated discharges and records. This page provides complete details of the discharges in a card view, including Vessel Name, Status, Voyage Number, Date, Discharge Item, Discharge Method, Discharge Category, Volume before m3 and Volume after m3. You can also Add, Delete, Change the status, View Status History and Access the details of each discharge. The following information are mandatory for adding a new Discharge: Vessel Name Date Voyage Number Discharge Item Discharge Method Discharge Category Master Chief Engineer Compactor Used Volume before m3 Volume after m3 Remarks Adding the Discharge details Follow the steps below to add a New Discharge detail: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add Discharge screen. Fill in the required details. Make sure to fill all the mandatory fields. Click the "Save" button. Accessing the Vessel Discharge Details Follow the steps below to view the required Vessel Discharge details: Click on the required card where the hyperlink is given. The system will display the details page by default. Modifying the Discharge details Follow the steps below to modify the required discharge detail: Click on the required card where the hyperlink is given. The system will display the details page by default. Click the Edit button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Documents This page provides details of the attached documents required for a particular Discharge details where you can upload, edit, view and delete. Adding a New Document Follow the steps below to add a new Document: Click on the "Upload" button. This will open up the Add Document screen. Add the Document description with required number of files. Click the " Save" button. Modifying the Document Follow the steps below to modify the Document: Hover over the required document. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon . The menu appears with two options - Edit and Delete . Click "Edit" option. This will open the Edit Documents screen where the attachments can be added or removed. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Viewing the Document Follow the steps below to view the Document: Click on the required attached document where the hyperlink is given for which you want to view the details. This will open the view documents page in read-only mode. Click the "Close" button to exit. Remember - You can save or print the required document from here. Deleting the Document Follow the steps below to delete the Document: Hover over the required document. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon . The menu appears with two options - Edit and Delete . Click "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Audit Log This page shows the audit log of the Transactions with their user details, log details and description. You can navigate through: Operations > Environmental Reports > Discharges > View Details > Audit Log The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the Discharge Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of required Discharge Status. Hover over the required card. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege.

Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the Discharge Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of required Discharge Status. Hover over the required card. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Viewing the Status History Follow the steps below to view the required status details: Click on the required Discharge Status where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the Status history details screen. Click the "Close" icon to exit. Deleting the Vessel Discharge detail Follow the steps below to delete the required vessel discharge: Hover over the required Vessel Discharge. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button.

High-risk transit refers to the movement of a vessel through a geographic area where there is an increased threat to the safety of the ship, its crew, or its cargo. You can access the High Risk Transit page from here: Explorer Menu > Operations > High Risk Transit Finding the High Risk Transit of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to search the required High-Risk Transit s: Select the required Vessels / Types / Fleets / Classes / Groups, Area, Voyage Number, Start Date and End Date in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system provides a list of vessels, including detailed records of their High-Risk Transit activities. T his page displays comprehensive information about a vessel’s high-risk transit, covering the Vessel Name, Voyage Number, Entry Date with time, Exit Date with time, Area, Entry Location, Exit Locations, Number of Days, and Current Status. The following information is mandatory for adding a new High-Risk Transit : Vessel Name Area Voyage Number Entry Date with time Entry Location Exit Date with time Exit Location Remarks Adding the High Risk Transit Follow the steps below to add a new High-Risk Transit : Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add High-Risk Transit screen. Fill in the required details. Make sure to fill all the mandatory fields. Click the "Save" button. Modifying the High Risk Transit Follow the steps below to modify the required High-Risk Transit: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Edit" option. This will open up the Edit High-Risk Transit screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - The vessel field will be disabled in Edit screen. Deleting the High Risk Transit Follow the steps below to delete the required High-Risk Transit: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Viewing the History Details This page shows the history details of each high-risk transit. The log records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Follow the steps below to view the required history details: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "History" option. This will open up the High-Risk Transit History details screen. Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log details. Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the High Risk Transit Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of required high-risk transit: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Viewing the Status History Follow the steps below to view the required status details: Click on the required High-Risk Transit Status where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the Status history details screen. Click the "Close" icon to exit.

This module is responsible for recording and managing technical details and operations of a vessel like Vessel Particulars, Vessel Budgets, Vessel Inspections, Contractor Exposure, Vessel PIQ, and MSQA Inspection . Registers - Registers serve as the primary control point for managing vessel details, ensuring accurate documentation and seamless data management across various categories like Vessel Particulars Vessel Budgets Vessel PIQ Vessel Inspections Contractor Exposure MSQA Inspections Navigating to Technical Register You can access the Vessel Particulars page from here :  Explorer Menu -> Technical Additionally, you can navigate through other submodules, including - Vessel Particulars, Vessel Budgets, Vessel Inspections, Contractor Exposure, Vessel PIQ, and MSQA Inspection .

The Vessel Particulars page is provided to maintain all generic and technical information pertaining to a registered vessel. Any vessel used in any part of the system should be first registered here. All the key information that are stored among the various modules can be viewed here. Note - First you need to register the Vessel Name under the Vessel Register in Master Data before you can update the vessel particulars. You can access the Vessel Particulars page from here :  Explorer Menu > Technical > Vessel Particulars Finding a Particular of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to search the required Vessel Particular details: Select the required Vessel Name, Vessel Type, Vessel Class, Vessel Groups or Vessel Status or Vessel Flag in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required Vessel Particulars. Viewing the Detail of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to view the required Vessel Particular details: a. Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particular details screen. b. Click the "Back" button or the "Vessel Particulars" given on the breadcrumbs which leads to the search and list page. Modifying the Vessel Particular Details Follow the steps below to modify the required Vessel Particular details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particulars tab. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - Under the "General" side tab, the "Yard Built" field should be completed first before entering information in the other fields within the side tabs.

Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Technical Details > Engine Related

__data__.text: This page provides comprehensive details related to the engine, including the Main Engine Manufacturer, Model, Propeller Pitch Type, Propeller Mean Pitch, and various Maximum Continuous Rating (MCR) Parameters (MCR ME, MCR Limited, MCR #1, MCR #2, MCR #3, MCR #4, MCR Emergency/Harbour Generator, and MCR Shaft Generator), as well as the Average Cylinder Oil Consumption. Modifying the Technical Details Follow the steps below to modify the required Technical details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particulars tab. Navigate to the Technical details where the Engine Related side tab is opened by default. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - Under the "General" side tab, the "Yard Built" field should be completed first before entering information in the other fields within the side tabs.

metadata.title: Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Technical Details > Environmental
Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Technical Details > Environmental

__data__.text: This page displays environmental details, including Scrubber Installation Status, Scrubber Type, SCR (Selective Catalytic Reduction) System, SCR Type, NOx Control Level Tier, Sewage Treatment System Capacity, BWTS (Ballast Water Treatment System) Manufacturer and Type, as well as CII (Carbon Intensity Indicator) for the previous year, EEXI (Energy Efficiency Existing Ship Index), and EEDI (Energy Efficiency Design Index). Modifying the Technical Details Follow the steps below to modify the required Technical details. Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particulars tab. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Environmental side tab. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - Under the "General" side tab, the "Yard Built" field should be completed first before entering information in the other fields within the side tabs.

metadata.title: Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Technical Details > Capacities
Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Technical Details > Capacities

__data__.text: This page provides the capacity details of cylinder lube oil, Dead Weight (DW) Capacity, Fresh Water Capacity, and Fuel Capacities along with their respective types, as well as information on the last update, including the updated by and updated on details Modifying the Technical Details Follow the steps below to modify the required Technical details. Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particulars tab. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - Under the "General" side tab, the "Yard Built" field should be completed first before entering information in the other fields within the side tabs. Modifying the Capacity Details Follow the steps below to modify the Capacity details : Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details . Click the "Update" button. Adding the Fuel Capacity Details Note - You can Add, Edit, View and Delete the capacity for Fuel from this section. The following information are mandatory for Adding a new Fuel Capacity: Fuel Type Fuel Capacity Follow the steps below to Add the Fuel Capacity details Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab. Click the " + New" button. Fill in the required details . Click the "Save" button. Modifying the Fuel Capacity Details Follow the steps below to modify the Capacity details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab. Hover the required Fuel Type. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Edit" option.  This will open up the Edit Fuel Capacity screen. Change the required details . Click the "Update" button. Note - The Capacity Field can be modified, while the F uel Type remains disabled. Viewing the Fuel Capacity Details Follow the steps below to view the Capacity details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab. Click on the required Fuel Type for which the hyperlink is given. This will open the  View Fuel Capacity details page in read-only mode. Click the "Close" button or icon to exit. Deleting the Fuel Capacity Details Follow the steps below to delete the Capacity details : Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab Hover the required Fuel Type. metadata.title: Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Audit Log
Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Audit Log

__data__.text: This page shows the audit log of the vessel particulars with their user details, log details and description. Note: Certain common functions, such as pagination, and download are available exclusively within table data. You can navigate through Technical > Vessel Particulars > View Details > Audit Log The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Audit Log tab. Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. Click the "Close" button to exit.

All outsourced work is recorded under contract exposure management to track cost, service providers, work scope, duration and compliance. Proper documentation ensures accountability, cost control and risk mitigation. Contract exposure records track costs, providers, work scope and compliance. You can add, edit, change status and view history for better accountability and control. You can access the Contractor Exposure page from here: Explorer Menu > Technical > Contractor Exposure Finding the Contractor Exposure Hours of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to search the required Contractor Exposure Hours: Select the required Vessel / Class / Type / Group, Year, Month, No. Of Hours and Status in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required list of Vessel with their Contractor Exposure Hours. This page provides complete details of a vessel, including the year, month, no. of hours, created by and status where you can Add, Edit, Delete, view, change the status, and history of each contractor exposure hour. The following information is mandatory for adding a new Contractor Exposure Hours: Vessel Name Year Month No. Of hours Adding the Contractor Exposure Hours Follow the steps below to add a new Contractor Exposure Hour: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add Contractor Exposure Hours screen. Fill in the required details. Click the "Save" button. Modifying the Contractor Exposure Hours Follow the steps below to modify the required contractor exposure hours: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Edit" option. This will open up Edit Contract Exposure screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Deleting the Contractor Exposure Hours Follow the steps below to delete the required contractor exposure hours: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Viewing the History Details This page shows us the history details of each contractor exposure hour. The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Follow the steps below to view the required history details: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "History" option. This will open up the Contractor Exposure History details screen. Click on the required particular transaction. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log details. Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the Contractor Exposure Hours Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of required contractor exposure hours: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Viewing the Status History Follow the steps below to view the required status details: Click on the required Contractor Exposure Status where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the Status history details screen. Click the "Close" icon to exit.

A Vessel PIQ (Pre-Inspection Questionnaire) is a form used before inspecting a ship. It collects important details about the vessel, like its specifications, safety equipment, crew, maintenance history, and compliance with regulations. The goal is to identify potential issues and ensure the vessel is ready for a full inspection. This helps streamline the process and make sure the ship meets all necessary standards. A Vessel (Pre-Inspection Questionnaire) also known as PIQ is a feature that helps the user to create a pre inspection questionnaire for production pre inspection before the main inspection. You can access the Vessel PIQ page from here :  Explorer Menu > Technical > Vessel PIQ Finding the Vessel PIQ for Each Vessel Follow the steps below to search the required Vessel PIQ: Select the required Vessels / Types / Classes / Groups, From Date, To Date and Status in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required Vessel PIQ. The page displays the list of vessels in a tabular format, with columns for Vessel Name, Vessel Type, Description, Date, Created by and Status of each PIQ. To Add a new Vessel PIQ, the following information is required: Vessel Name Description. Adding the Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to add a new Vessel PIQ: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add PIQ screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Modifying the Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to modify the Vessel PIQ: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete, and Print options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Edit" option. This will open up the Edit PIQ screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Printing the Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to print the Vessel PIQ: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete, and Print options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Print" option. This will open up the print preview screen. Click the "Print" button to get a copy. Deleting the Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to delete the Vessel PIQ: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete, and Print options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Viewing the details of Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to view the Vessel PIQ details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel PIQ details tab by default. The page has two sections: one shows the PIQ chapters, and the other shows a card view with multiple sections under each chapter. Each section can be expanded to view questions under the respective sections. Modifying the Section Details of Each Chapter Follow the steps below to modify the section details of each chapter: Click on the desired chapter to open the corresponding section. Click the arrow icon to expand the corresponding section. Click the Edit button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Audit Log This page shows the audit log of the Vessel PIQ with their user details, log details and description. You can navigate through Technical >Vessel PIQ > View Details > Audit Log The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. . Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the Vessel PIQ Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of Vessel PIQ: Hover over the required Vessel.

Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. . Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the Vessel PIQ Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. A Vessel Inspection is a safety check to ensure a ship or industrial tank is in good condition and meets regulations. It helps to find issues like leaks, cracks, or corrosion to prevent accidents. You can access the Vessel Inspection page from here : Explorer Menu > Technical > Vessel Inspections Finding a Particular Vessel Inspection Follow the steps below to search the required Vessel Inspection details: Select the required Vessels, Types, Classes, Groups or Inspection Type or Company or Inspector Type or Start Date or End Date or Status or Other Filters in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required Vessel Inspections. This page displays vessel inspection details in a table format, including columns such as Vessel Name, Start Date, Inspection Type, Company, Inspector Type, Port Name, Total Findings, Open Findings, Overdue, Due in 2 Weeks, Due in a Month, Created by and Status. The following information is mandatory for adding a new Vessel Inspection: Vessel Name Inspection Type Inspector Type Company Start Port End Port Start Date End Date Master Chief Engineer Inspector Office Support Person Sailing Inspector Qualification Inspector Details Adding the Vessel Inspection Follow the steps given below to add a new Vessel Inspection: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add Inspection details screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Viewing the Detail of Each Vessel Inspection Follow the steps below to view the required Vessel Inspection details: Click on the required Start Date where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Inspection details screen. Click the "Back" button or the "Vessel Inspection" given on the breadcrumbs which leads to the search and list page. Changing the Status of Vessel Inspection Hover over the required Finding. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Deleting the Vessel Inspection Follow the steps below to delete the required Vessel Inspection: Hover over the required vessel inspection. The 3dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon. The menu with two options - Edit and Delete will be displayed. Click "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button.

A Marine Safety Quality Assurance also known as MSQA ,  is a form that provides key information about a ship before an inspection or charter. It includes details like the vessel’s type, owner, certificates, crew, and inspection history. This helps charterers and inspectors decide if the ship meets safety and operational standards. You can access the MSQA Inspection page from here : Explorer Menu > Technical > MSQA Inspection Finding a Particular MSQA Inspection Follow the steps below to search the required MSQA Inspection details: Select the required Vessels, Types, Classes, Groups or Inspection Type or Start Date or End Date or Status or Inspection Type or Company in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required MSQA Inspections. This page displays MSQA inspection details in a table format, including columns such as Vessel Name, Inspection Type, Start Date, End Date, Company, Findings, SOC, NOC, Overdue, Created by and Status. This page allows you to add, edit, delete, view details and update the applicable status for a specific MSQA Inspection. The following information is required for adding a new MSQA Inspection: Vessel Name Inspection Type Company Start Date End Date Operation From Port To Port Office Support Inspector Master Chief Engineer Remarks Adding the MSQA Inspection Follow the steps given below to add a new MSQA Inspection: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add New Inspection Details screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Viewing MSQA Inspection Details Follow the steps below to view the MSQA Inspection details: Click on the Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given for which you want to view the details. This will open the details page. Modifying the MSQA Inspection Details Follow the steps below to modify the details of MSQA Inspection: Click on the Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given for which you want to modify the details. This will open the details page by default. Click the "Edit" option. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Findings Adding the Finding Details Follow the steps below to add a new Finding detail: Click on the "+ New Finding" button. This will open up the Add Finding screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Viewing the Finding Details Under Findings, you can click the arrow to expand and view the details of the SOC. . The added Findings will appear in the card view. The total count of added Findings, SOC, and NOC will be displayed next to the heading. Follow the steps below to view the required Finding details: Select the desired Finding and click the corresponding arrow to proceed. A separate section for SOC will be displayed, allowing you to add, edit, delete and change the status. Subject of Concern - SOC The Subject of Concern is also known as SOC. Adding the SOC Details Follow the steps below to add a new SOC detail: Click on the "+ New SOC" button. This will open up the Add SOC screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Modifying the SOC Follow the steps below to modify the required SOC: Hover over the required SOC. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon . The menu appears with three options - Applicable Status, Edit and Delete will be displayed. Click "Edit" option. This will open the Edit SOC screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Changing the SOC Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of required SOC Status: Hover over the required SOC. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Viewing the details of SOC To view SOC details, expand the required SOC. It has two tabs—SOC Details will be opened in default and 'SOC Documents'—to access the added information. The SOC Details page displays the information provided when the SOC was created.

This module is responsible for recording and managing technical details and operations of a vessel like Vessel Particulars, Vessel Budgets, Vessel Inspections, Contractor Exposure, Vessel PIQ, and MSQA Inspection . Registers - Registers serve as the primary control point for managing vessel details, ensuring accurate documentation and seamless data management across various categories like Vessel Particulars Vessel Budgets Vessel PIQ Vessel Inspections Contractor Exposure MSQA Inspections Navigating to Technical Register You can access the Vessel Particulars page from here :  Explorer Menu -> Technical Additionally, you can navigate through other submodules, including - Vessel Particulars, Vessel Budgets, Vessel Inspections, Contractor Exposure, Vessel PIQ, and MSQA Inspection .

The Vessel Particulars page is provided to maintain all generic and technical information pertaining to a registered vessel. Any vessel used in any part of the system should be first registered here. All the key information that are stored among the various modules can be viewed here. Note - First you need to register the Vessel Name under the Vessel Register in Master Data before you can update the vessel particulars. You can access the Vessel Particulars page from here :  Explorer Menu > Technical > Vessel Particulars Finding a Particular of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to search the required Vessel Particular details: Select the required Vessel Name, Vessel Type, Vessel Class, Vessel Groups or Vessel Status or Vessel Flag in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required Vessel Particulars. Viewing the Detail of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to view the required Vessel Particular details: a. Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particular details screen. b. Click the "Back" button or the "Vessel Particulars" given on the breadcrumbs which leads to the search and list page. Modifying the Vessel Particular Details Follow the steps below to modify the required Vessel Particular details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particulars tab. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - Under the "General" side tab, the "Yard Built" field should be completed first before entering information in the other fields within the side tabs.

__data__.text: This page provides comprehensive details related to the engine, including the Main Engine Manufacturer, Model, Propeller Pitch Type, Propeller Mean Pitch, and various Maximum Continuous Rating (MCR) Parameters (MCR ME, MCR Limited, MCR #1, MCR #2, MCR #3, MCR #4, MCR Emergency/Harbour Generator, and MCR Shaft Generator), as well as the Average Cylinder Oil Consumption. Modifying the Technical Details Follow the steps below to modify the required Technical details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particulars tab. Navigate to the Technical details where the Engine Related side tab is opened by default. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - Under the "General" side tab, the "Yard Built" field should be completed first before entering information in the other fields within the side tabs.

__data__.text: This page displays environmental details, including Scrubber Installation Status, Scrubber Type, SCR (Selective Catalytic Reduction) System, SCR Type, NOx Control Level Tier, Sewage Treatment System Capacity, BWTS (Ballast Water Treatment System) Manufacturer and Type, as well as CII (Carbon Intensity Indicator) for the previous year, EEXI (Energy Efficiency Existing Ship Index), and EEDI (Energy Efficiency Design Index). Modifying the Technical Details Follow the steps below to modify the required Technical details. Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particulars tab. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Environmental side tab. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - Under the "General" side tab, the "Yard Built" field should be completed first before entering information in the other fields within the side tabs.

metadata.title: Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Technical Details > Capacities
Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Technical Details > Capacities

__data__.text: This page provides the capacity details of cylinder lube oil, Dead Weight (DW) Capacity, Fresh Water Capacity, and Fuel Capacities along with their respective types, as well as information on the last update, including the updated by and updated on details Modifying the Technical Details Follow the steps below to modify the required Technical details. Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particulars tab. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Note - Under the "General" side tab, the "Yard Built" field should be completed first before entering information in the other fields within the side tabs. Modifying the Capacity Details Follow the steps below to modify the Capacity details : Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details . Click the "Update" button. Adding the Fuel Capacity Details Note - You can Add, Edit, View and Delete the capacity for Fuel from this section. The following information are mandatory for Adding a new Fuel Capacity: Fuel Type Fuel Capacity Follow the steps below to Add the Fuel Capacity details Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab. Click the " + New" button. Fill in the required details . Click the "Save" button. Modifying the Fuel Capacity Details Follow the steps below to modify the Capacity details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab. Hover the required Fuel Type. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Edit" option.  This will open up the Edit Fuel Capacity screen. Change the required details . Click the "Update" button. Note - The Capacity Field can be modified, while the F uel Type remains disabled. Viewing the Fuel Capacity Details Follow the steps below to view the Capacity details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab. Click on the required Fuel Type for which the hyperlink is given. This will open the  View Fuel Capacity details page in read-only mode. Click the "Close" button or icon to exit. Deleting the Fuel Capacity Details Follow the steps below to delete the Capacity details : Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Technical details and click on the required Capacities side tab Hover the required Fuel Type. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button.

__data__.text: How to manage the Management Details of a Vessel? This page shows us the  complete record of a vessel's management history: Present Management Details – Includes Start and End Dates, Estimated Departure Date, and Previous Manager. Management History – Shows Previous Name, Name Change Date, Previous Owner, Owner Change Date, Previous Flag, and Flag Change Date. Modifying the Management Details Follow the steps below to modify the Management details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Management tab. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details . Click the "Update" button.

How to manage the Communication Details of a Vessel? This page provides various communication details of a specific vessel where you can Add, Edit and Delete the Communication Details . The following information is mandatory for adding a new Communication Type: Communication Type Communication Number Remarks Archived Note: Certain common functions, such as pagination, download, sorting, and archived , are available exclusively within table data. The table data encompasses the Communication tab, Technical (Capacities), Contacts, Tanks, Sea Trials, Anti-Fouling, and Equipment Configuration . A flag is displayed in the table to indicate that a remark has been added for the communication type. When hovered over, a tooltip reveals the remark in its expanded form. Adding the Communication Type Follow the steps below to Add the Communication Type details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. Deleting the Communication Details Follow the steps below to delete the Communication details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Communication  tab. Hover over the required Communication Type. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button.

Viewing the Tank Details Follow the steps below to view the Tank details : Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Tanks tab. Navigate to the appropriate Tank Type side tab. Click on the Compartment where the hyperlink is given. This will open the  View vessel Tank details screen in read-only mode. Click the "Close" button or icon to exit. Change the required details . Click the "Update" button. Note - You can edit only specific fields based on the selected tank type. Not all fields can be edited in this screen. metadata.title: Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Audit Log
Technical Module > Vessel Particulars > Audit Log

__data__.text: This page shows the audit log of the vessel particulars with their user details, log details and description. Note: Certain common functions, such as pagination, and download are available exclusively within table data. You can navigate through Technical > Vessel Particulars > View Details > Audit Log The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the Vessel Particular details screen. Navigate to the Audit Log tab. Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. Click the "Close" button to exit.

All outsourced work is recorded under contract exposure management to track cost, service providers, work scope, duration and compliance. Proper documentation ensures accountability, cost control and risk mitigation. Contract exposure records track costs, providers, work scope and compliance. You can add, edit, change status and view history for better accountability and control. You can access the Contractor Exposure page from here: Explorer Menu > Technical > Contractor Exposure Finding the Contractor Exposure Hours of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to search the required Contractor Exposure Hours: Select the required Vessel / Class / Type / Group, Year, Month, No. Of Hours and Status in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required list of Vessel with their Contractor Exposure Hours. This page provides complete details of a vessel, including the year, month, no. of hours, created by and status where you can Add, Edit, Delete, view, change the status, and history of each contractor exposure hour. The following information is mandatory for adding a new Contractor Exposure Hours: Vessel Name Year Month No. Of hours Adding the Contractor Exposure Hours Follow the steps below to add a new Contractor Exposure Hour: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add Contractor Exposure Hours screen. Fill in the required details. Click the "Save" button. Modifying the Contractor Exposure Hours Follow the steps below to modify the required contractor exposure hours: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Edit" option. This will open up Edit Contract Exposure screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Deleting the Contractor Exposure Hours Follow the steps below to delete the required contractor exposure hours: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Viewing the History Details This page shows us the history details of each contractor exposure hour. The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Follow the steps below to view the required history details: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "History" option. This will open up the Contractor Exposure History details screen. Click on the required particular transaction. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log details. Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the Contractor Exposure Hours Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of required contractor exposure hours: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete and History option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Viewing the Status History Follow the steps below to view the required status details: Click on the required Contractor Exposure Status where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the Status history details screen. Click the "Close" icon to exit.

A Vessel PIQ (Pre-Inspection Questionnaire) is a form used before inspecting a ship. It collects important details about the vessel, like its specifications, safety equipment, crew, maintenance history, and compliance with regulations. The goal is to identify potential issues and ensure the vessel is ready for a full inspection. This helps streamline the process and make sure the ship meets all necessary standards. A Vessel (Pre-Inspection Questionnaire) also known as PIQ is a feature that helps the user to create a pre inspection questionnaire for production pre inspection before the main inspection. You can access the Vessel PIQ page from here :  Explorer Menu > Technical > Vessel PIQ Finding the Vessel PIQ for Each Vessel Follow the steps below to search the required Vessel PIQ: Select the required Vessels / Types / Classes / Groups, From Date, To Date and Status in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required Vessel PIQ. The page displays the list of vessels in a tabular format, with columns for Vessel Name, Vessel Type, Description, Date, Created by and Status of each PIQ. To Add a new Vessel PIQ, the following information is required: Vessel Name Description. Adding the Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to add a new Vessel PIQ: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add PIQ screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Modifying the Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to modify the Vessel PIQ: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete, and Print options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Edit" option. This will open up the Edit PIQ screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Printing the Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to print the Vessel PIQ: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete, and Print options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Print" option. This will open up the print preview screen. Click the "Print" button to get a copy. Deleting the Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to delete the Vessel PIQ: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete, and Print options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Viewing the details of Vessel PIQ Follow the steps below to view the Vessel PIQ details: Click on the required Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel PIQ details tab by default. The page has two sections: one shows the PIQ chapters, and the other shows a card view with multiple sections under each chapter. Each section can be expanded to view questions under the respective sections. Modifying the Section Details of Each Chapter Follow the steps below to modify the section details of each chapter: Click on the desired chapter to open the corresponding section. Click the arrow icon to expand the corresponding section. Click the Edit button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Audit Log This page shows the audit log of the Vessel PIQ with their user details, log details and description. You can navigate through Technical >Vessel PIQ > View Details > Audit Log The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. . Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the Vessel PIQ Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of Vessel PIQ: Hover over the required Vessel.

Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. Viewing the details of Each Audit Log Follow the steps below to view the log details: Click on the required particular log. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. . Click the "Close" button to exit. Changing the Vessel PIQ Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of Vessel PIQ: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, Delete, and History options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Viewing the Status History Follow the steps below to view the required status details: Click on the required Vessel PIQ Status where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the Status history details screen. Click the "Close" icon to exit.

A Vessel Inspection is a safety check to ensure a ship or industrial tank is in good condition and meets regulations. It helps to find issues like leaks, cracks, or corrosion to prevent accidents. You can access the Vessel Inspection page from here : Explorer Menu > Technical > Vessel Inspections Finding a Particular Vessel Inspection Follow the steps below to search the required Vessel Inspection details: Select the required Vessels, Types, Classes, Groups or Inspection Type or Company or Inspector Type or Start Date or End Date or Status or Other Filters in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required Vessel Inspections. This page displays vessel inspection details in a table format, including columns such as Vessel Name, Start Date, Inspection Type, Company, Inspector Type, Port Name, Total Findings, Open Findings, Overdue, Due in 2 Weeks, Due in a Month, Created by and Status. The following information is mandatory for adding a new Vessel Inspection: Vessel Name Inspection Type Inspector Type Company Start Port End Port Start Date End Date Master Chief Engineer Inspector Office Support Person Sailing Inspector Qualification Inspector Details Adding the Vessel Inspection Follow the steps given below to add a new Vessel Inspection: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add Inspection details screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Viewing the Detail of Each Vessel Inspection Follow the steps below to view the required Vessel Inspection details: Click on the required Start Date where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Inspection details screen. Click the "Back" button or the "Vessel Inspection" given on the breadcrumbs which leads to the search and list page. Changing the Status of Vessel Inspection Hover over the required Finding. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Deleting the Vessel Inspection Follow the steps below to delete the required Vessel Inspection: Hover over the required vessel inspection. The 3dot icon appears to reveal the Edit and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon. The menu with two options - Edit and Delete will be displayed. Click "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button.

Viewing the Detail of Each Vessel Follow the steps below to view the required Vessel Inspection details: Click on the required Start Date where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Inspection details screen. Click the "Back" button or the "Vessel Inspection" given on the breadcrumbs which leads to the search and list page. Modifying the Detail of Each Vessel Inspection Follow the steps below to modify the required Vessel Inspection details: Click on the required Start Date where the hyperlink is given. This will open the Vessel Inspection details screen. Click the " Edit" button. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button.

This page shows us the details like the list of finding in that particular vessel in a tabular form with column like Finding Type, Serial Number, Target Date, Created by and Status. You can access the Findings page from here : Explorer Menu > Technical > Vessel Inspection > View details > Findings. Under this page we can add new finding, change the status of each finding, can access the details page and delete a finding. The following information is mandatory for adding a new Finding: Finding Type Target Date Finding Details Lack of Familiarity / Training needed. Observation Category Adding the Finding Follow the steps given below to add a new Finding: Click on the "+ New" button. This will open up the Add Finding details screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Accessing the Detail of Each Vessel Finding Follow the steps below to view the required finding details: Click on the required Finding Type where the hyperlink is given. This will open the findings details screen. Click the "Arrow" button to view the back page or the "Vessel Inspection" given on the breadcrumbs which leads to the search and list page. Changing the Status of Each Finding Follow the steps below to change the status of Finding: Hover over the required Finding. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Deleting the Finding Follow the steps below to delete the required Finding: Hover over the required Finding. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Current Status and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon. The menu with two options - Edit and Delete will be displayed. Click "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button.

A Marine Safety Quality Assurance also known as MSQA ,  is a form that provides key information about a ship before an inspection or charter. It includes details like the vessel’s type, owner, certificates, crew, and inspection history. This helps charterers and inspectors decide if the ship meets safety and operational standards. You can access the MSQA Inspection page from here : Explorer Menu > Technical > MSQA Inspection Finding a Particular MSQA Inspection Follow the steps below to search the required MSQA Inspection details: Select the required Vessels, Types, Classes, Groups or Inspection Type or Start Date or End Date or Status or Inspection Type or Company in the search field. Click the "Search" button. The system will display the list of the required MSQA Inspections. This page displays MSQA inspection details in a table format, including columns such as Vessel Name, Inspection Type, Start Date, End Date, Company, Findings, SOC, NOC, Overdue, Created by and Status. This page allows you to add, edit, delete, view details and update the applicable status for a specific MSQA Inspection. This will open up the Add New Inspection Details screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Viewing MSQA Inspection Details Follow the steps below to view the MSQA Inspection details: Click on the Vessel Name where the hyperlink is given for which you want to view the details. This will open the details page. This will open the details page by default. Click the "Edit" option. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Viewing the Finding Details Under Findings, you can click the arrow to expand and view the details of the SOC. . The added Findings will appear in the card view. The total count of added Findings, SOC, and NOC will be displayed next to the heading. Follow the steps below to view the required Finding details: Select the desired Finding and click the corresponding arrow to proceed. A separate section for SOC will be displayed, allowing you to add, edit, delete and change the status. Subject of Concern - SOC The Subject of Concern is also known as SOC. Adding the SOC Details Follow the steps below to add a new SOC detail: Click on the "+ New SOC" button. This will open up the Add SOC screen. Fill in the required details. Ensure all mandatory fields are completed. Click the "Save" button. Modifying the SOC Follow the steps below to modify the required SOC: Hover over the required SOC. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon . The menu appears with three options - Applicable Status, Edit and Delete will be displayed. Click "Edit" option. This will open the Edit SOC screen. Change the required details. Click the "Update" button. Changing the SOC Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of required SOC Status: Hover over the required SOC. The 3 Dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit and Delete option. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Viewing the details of SOC To view SOC details, expand the required SOC. It has two tabs—SOC Details will be opened in default and 'SOC Documents'—to access the added information. The SOC Details page displays the information provided when the SOC was created.

The menu appears with two options - Edit and Delete will be displayed. Click "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Audit Log This page shows the audit log of the MSQA Inspections  with their user details, log details and description. You can navigate through Technical >MSQA Inspections > View Details > Audit Log The transaction records are structured as follows: The most recent transactions from the last 7 days are displayed first, followed by transactions from the past 30 days. Older transactions are categorized separately in the 'Older Transactions' section for easy reference. This will open up the View Details screen in read-only mode which shows the log data and log description. . Click the "Close" button to exit. Deleting the MSQA Inspection Follow the steps below to delete the MSQA Inspection: Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Delete" option. This will open up the confirmation pop up screen. Click "Yes Proceed" button. Changing the MSQA Inspection Status The status can be configured through workflows based on specific requirements, allowing for a structured and customized approval process. This ensures that status changes align with operational needs and predefined workflow rules. Remember - The applicable status and revert status can be configured as per requirements and managed through the workflow with its privileges. Follow the steps below to change the status of required MSQA Inspection Status. Hover over the required Vessel. The 3 dot icon appears to reveal the Applicable Status, Edit, and Delete options. Click the 3 Dot Icon and select the "Applicable Status" option. Note - The status will be shown from the workflow based on the requirement and its privilege. Change the required status. This will show the confirmation message for each status change. Viewing the Status History Follow the steps below to view the required status details: Click on the required MSQA Status where the hyperlink is given. This will open up the Status history details screen. Click the "Close" icon to exit.
